content.webTitle: MP wants airline to pay for repairs to car hit by ice

fields.headline: MP wants airline to pay for repairs to car hit by ice
fields.bodyText: Tests should be carried out on a lump of ice that fell from a plane on to a car to establish which airline must pay for repairs, a Tory MP said yesterday. Stephanie Cole, 25, had left her car outside her parents' house in Great Glen, Leicestershire. She paid the £700 bill herself because she has been unable to find out which plane the football-size chunk fell from. Harborough MP Edward Garnier wants the Department for Transport to pay for tests on the ice. A spokesman for the Civil Aviation Authority said airlines had no control over ice that fell from an aircraft's fuselage. Such incidents were rare, he added.
